itemDescription: English botanist, gardener and photographer in Jamaica and Guyana (1845-1902)

wikipedia_page.main: George Samuel Jenman (1845-1902) was a British gardener and botanist.  He specialized in growing and studying plants. He was superintendent of Castleton Botanical Garden, Jamaica from 1873 to 1879, and Government Botanist and superintendent of the Botanical Gardens in British Guiana (now Guyana) from 1879 to 1902. Jenman was also a member of the Linnean Society.
